verses.verse: Woe <WH480> is me! for I am as when they have gathered <WH622> the summer <WH7019> fruits, as the grape gleanings <WH5955> of the vintage: <WH1210> there is no <WH369> cluster <WH811> to eat: <WH398> my soul <WH5315> desired <WH183> the first ripe <WH1063> fruit.

The good <WH2623> man is perished <WH6> out of the earth: <WH776> and there is none <WH369> upright <WH3477> among men: <WH120> they all <WH3605> lie in wait <WH693> for blood; <WH1818> they hunt <WH6679> every man <WH376> his brother <WH251> with a net. <WH2764>

That they may do evil <WH7451> with both hands <WH3709> earnestly, <WH3190> the prince <WH8269> asks, <WH7592> and the judge <WH8199> asks <WH7592> for a reward; <WH7966> and the great <WH1419> man, he utters <WH1696> his mischievous <WH1942> desire: <WH5315> so they wrap <WH5686> it up.

The best <WH2896> of them is as a brier: <WH2312> the most upright <WH3477> is sharper than a thorn <WH4534> hedge: <WH4534> the day <WH3117> of your watchmen <WH6822> and your visitation <WH6486> comes; <WH935> now <WH6258> shall be their perplexity. <WH3998>

Trust <WH539> you not in a friend, <WH7453> put you not confidence <WH982> in a guide: <WH441> keep <WH8104> the doors <WH6607> of your mouth <WH6310> from her that lies <WH7901> in your bosom. <WH2436>

For the son <WH1121> dishonors <WH5034> the father, <WH2> the daughter <WH1323> rises <WH6965> up against her mother, <WH517> the daughter <WH3618> in law <WH3618> against her mother <WH2545> in law; <WH2545> a man's <WH376> enemies <WH341> are the men <WH582> of his own house. <WH1004>
Therefore I will look <WH6822> to the LORD; <WH3068> I will wait <WH3176> for the God <WH430> of my salvation: <WH3468> my God <WH430> will hear <WH8085> me.
Rejoice <WH8056> not against me, O my enemy: <WH341> when <WH3588> I fall, <WH5307> I shall arise; <WH6965> when I sit <WH3427> in darkness, <WH2822> the LORD <WH3068> shall be a light <WH216> to me.

I will bear <WH5375> the indignation <WH2197> of the LORD, <WH3068> because <WH3588> I have sinned <WH2398> against him, until <WH5704> he plead <WH7378> my cause, <WH7379> and execute <WH6213> judgment <WH4941> for me: he will bring <WH3318> me forth <WH3318> to the light, <WH216> and I shall behold <WH7200> his righteousness. <WH6666>

Then she that is my enemy <WH341> shall see <WH7200> it, and shame <WH955> shall cover <WH3680> her which said <WH559> to me, Where <WH346> is the LORD <WH3068> your God? <WH430> my eyes <WH5869> shall behold <WH7200> her: now <WH6258> shall she be trodden <WH4823> down as the mire <WH2916> of the streets. <WH2351>
In the day <WH3117> that your walls <WH1447> are to be built, <WH1129> in that day <WH3117> shall the decree <WH2706> be far <WH7368> removed.

In that day <WH3117> also he shall come <WH935> even to you from Assyria, <WH804> and from the fortified <WH4692> cities, <WH5892> and from the fortress <WH4693> even to the river, <WH5104> and from sea <WH3220> to sea, <WH3220> and from mountain <WH2022> to mountain. <WH2022>
Notwithstanding the land <WH776> shall be desolate <WH8077> because <WH5921> of them that dwell <WH3427> therein, for the fruit <WH6529> of their doings. <WH4611>

Feed <WH7462> your people <WH5971> with your rod, <WH7626> the flock <WH6629> of your heritage, <WH5159> which dwell <WH7931> solitarily <WH910> in the wood, <WH3293> in the middle <WH8432> of Carmel: <WH3760> let them feed <WH7462> in Bashan <WH1316> and Gilead, <WH1568> as in the days <WH3117> of old. <WH5769>
According to the days <WH3117> of your coming <WH3318> out of the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714> will I show <WH7200> to him marvelous <WH6381> things.

The nations <WH1471> shall see <WH7200> and be confounded <WH954> at all <WH3605> their might: <WH1369> they shall lay <WH7760> their hand <WH3027> on their mouth, <WH6310> their ears <WH241> shall be deaf. <WH2790>

They shall lick <WH3897> the dust <WH6083> like a serpent, <WH5175> they shall move <WH7264> out of their holes <WH4526> like worms <WH2119> of the earth: <WH776> they shall be afraid <WH6342> of the LORD <WH3068> our God, <WH430> and shall fear <WH3372> because of you.

Who <WH4310> is a God <WH410> like <WH3644> to you, that pardons <WH5375> iniquity, <WH5771> and passes <WH5674> by the transgression <WH6588> of the remnant <WH7611> of his heritage? <WH5159> he retains <WH2388> not his anger <WH639> for ever, <WH5703> because <WH3588> he delights <WH2654> in mercy. <WH2617>

He will turn <WH7725> again, <WH7725> he will have compassion <WH7355> on us; he will subdue <WH3533> our iniquities; <WH5771> and you will cast <WH7993> all <WH3605> their sins <WH2403> into the depths <WH4688> of the sea. <WH3220>

You will perform <WH5414> the truth <WH571> to Jacob, <WH3290> and the mercy <WH2617> to Abraham, <WH85> which <WH834> you have sworn <WH7650> to our fathers <WH1> from the days <WH3117> of old. <WH6924>
